inn1.comm: full on off stump, defended into the covers
driven off the back foot to short cover
pushed across full outside off, left alone
he's away, dropped in short by Mathews and Moeen latches on with a front-foot pull which goes in the air over midwicket
back of a length at off stump, punched into the covers
on a good length, nips back off the seam and takes Moeen high on the back leg
starts very wide, but it swings considerably...Hales tries to reach it but it barely pitches on the cut strip
big strike! Gets his line straighter, it's full outside off, Hales is tempted into having a drive and a thick outside flies at chest height to Jayawardene at slip
full outside off, left alone, carries at ankle height to Sangakkara
shuffles across the crease and defends a delivery which was outside off into midwicket
gets right across his stumps again, both feet end up outside off, and he punches into the off side
beaten! Lovely delivery. More swing for Prasad. Full outside off, draws Taylor forward and feels for it away from his body. The ball didn't carry to Sangakkara
a strangled appeal for lbw, Taylor shuffling around again, but he's got some bat on this and is off the mark with a run towards square leg
full outside off, gentle pace, defended towards the on side
really is moving a lot in the crease, gets onto off stump again and defends with an open face to backward point
opens the face again and finds the gap this time down to third man
done for a lack of pace, aiming to take this delivery from outside off into the leg side and gets beaten on the inside edge
nice-looking shot, leans into a flowing drive but there is cover out at deep point
punched off the back foot between cover and mid-off
full outside off, he lets it go through
gets across outside off, comes off a think inside edge into his pads
probing line just outside off, Taylor solidly blocks into the off side...wonder if the bowler would fancy trying to ping one into leg stump? Taylor often leaves it exposed

big appeal for lbw! Taylor caught on the crease by a good-length delivery which nipped back and struck him above the knee roll, but height not often an issue when Taylor is on strike. Might have been sliding down leg. Was just clipping
left alone outside off
that's a cracker! Back of a length, nips away off the seam and beats the outside edge. Superb over from Prasad.
full outside off, he comes forward and drives towards mid-off who is deep enough to allow a comfortable single
a slightly uppish drive, but played safely enough. He drives a full delivery towards the left of mid-off where Herath goes down in instalments and dives over the ball
driven strongly square of the wicket to deep point
gets across outside off stump and defends a length delivery to the covers
terrific fielding at backward point by Dilshan, intercepts Taylor's strong square drive which looked to be heading for the boundary
that's very loose, it almost seemed a late decision to play. Was wide outside off and Taylor just fiddled at it with a cross-batted poke
that's a gorgeous piece of timing as he flicks this off his pads through straight midwicket and deep square has to get his stakes on to cut it off
started outside leg and swung further, ended as a big wide
full on middle, defended with a straight bat
full on the stumps, shaping back into the left handed, punched firmly to mid-off
frees his arms this time, it was full and wide outside off, driven powerfully wide of the short cover and past mid-off
that's superbly classy from Moeen, this time the delivery is slightly short and he drives it on the up off the back foot with a little flick of the wrists
fuller at off stump, defended towards backward point
a fullish ball outside off, the batsman moves forward to drive and makes good contact but can't beat short cover
good length angling into the right-hander, Taylor stays in his crease and dabs towards midwicket for a quick single, there's a direct hit at the bowler's end but Taylor is easily safe
Moeen reaches for a wide one and drives through cover for one more
Taylor skips down the track but is met with a short of a length ball that cramps him for room, he ends up playing it towards the bowler

gosh Taylor is quick, he drove a fuller ball firmly towards mid-on and sprinted away for a single, the fielder ran to his left, picked up and hit the stumps direct at the non-striker's end, Taylor was safe again
Moeen stays back and drives through cover for a single
tight line and length, wicket to wicket, Moeen stays in his crease and blocks

oh my! Moeen stepped out of his crease and had an almighty heave, he wasn't close to the pitch of the ball and it fell well short of him and spun away to beat the bat, the keeper had loads of time to make the stumping. Hang on, Sangakkara said there was an edge. Either way, that's out.
nudged off the pads off the back foot through midwicket for a single
Taylor tries to cut off the back foot but is beaten outside off stump
worked off the pads through square for a single
Root stays in his crease and punches towards long on for a single, Dilshan tries to run to his right to stop it but the non striker is in his way, he wouldn't have got to it anyway
starts by offering up some width, Taylor square drives into the ground and the ball bounces over backward point
that's very, very wide outside off
width, again, but Taylor misses out as he only connects with fresh air while trying to play it square through the off side
excellent fielding, Thirimanne at short cover, to cut off a drive by Taylor as he goes after a full, wide delivery
well, well...that's what we've seen plenty of in domestic cricket. Comes down the pitch, fetches this from outside off and deposits it over deep midwicket with a strong bottom-handed flick
driven up to mid-off
dispatches this one, too. It's a short ball from Perera which Taylor pounces on with a rasping pull through square leg
slides on with the arm, cut it off the stumps to short third man
uses his feet, then defends with bat and pad together
that had him in trouble! Grips and takes the outside edge as Taylor was squared up
driven back to the bowler
angled into leg stump, swept strongly out to deep square
defended into the off side
full outside off, defended to the covers
tucked off his pads through midwicket
nicely bowled, full outside off, moving away from Root who is drawn into pushing at the delivery and gets beaten
driven square to point
plays across a straight delivery around off stump and finds midwicket
opens the face to a full delivery outside off, down to third man
short of a length, driven off the back foot to the cover sweeper
gets well forward and defends to the off side
this one slides on, Taylor punches off the back foot to the sweeper
fired in full, driven down to long off
confident footwork, takes a couple of strides down the pitch and drives to long off
drifts onto the pads and it's clipped to deep square
full outside off, a gentle delivery, left alone
tighter to the stumps, driven up to mid-off
quite wide outside off, Root tries to flick it to the on side but just gets it back to the bowler
worked into the leg side
full outside off, dabbed square of the wicket towards point
works a full, straight delivery through the leg side and there's a little fumble by Kusal in the deep although Taylor was always making that into a second
blimey, that's close! Almost caught behind and almost bowled. Root trying to late-cut a delivery that was very tight to off stump
this one is played more securely, cut to deep point
big appeal for lbw, although perhaps more so from Sangakkara, as Taylor is taking on the pad as he sweeps but that's going down the leg side
driven to cover
driven hard into the pitch and back to the bowler
connects with the sweep this time, well placed through square leg which allows him another brace
starts short of a length, punched to midwicket
short outside off, Root drives off the back foot to the cover sweeper
pushed into the off side
takes this off the stumps and sends it to deep point
low full toss which he puts away which a bottom-handed whip through midwicket
now this is short outside off, he goes onto the back foot and places it wide of the sweeper
compact footwork as he comes down the pitch then drives to long off
comes forward and pushes at a full delivery with an open face
slides into the pads
tight run! Dabbed straight to short third man but Taylor races out of the blocks at the non-striker's end and actually makes it quite comfortably
opens the face as he drives to place this wide of cover
defended a little awkwardly on the back foot, squared up a little by some turn
chopped off the stumps to cover
touch quicker, pushed into the on side
full on middle, defended
driven down the ground to long on
firmly flicked back to the bowler
comes down the pitch and ends up yorking himself, just bunts the delivery back to Mendis
loses his shape on the shot as he tries to heave this into the leg side off the toe-end of the bat
hit and go...whipped with string wrists straight to midwicket but Taylor is so quick between the wickets
dabbed into the off side
slightly shorter, played off the back foot into the off side
fired in full, dug out back to Herath
opens the face off the back foot and finds point
goes for the sweep, it's a loopier delivery, gets taken on the pad
played back to the bowler
nearly a mix-up! Taylor was down the pitch, driving firmly to mid-on. Taylor was off straight away but Root had needed to take evasive action at the non-striker's end so couldn't respond as quickly
given! Going for the sweep, and umpire Davis is up quickly. But Taylor signals for a review instantly which suggests he's confident he's hit it. And the reply shows a healthy bottom edge into the pad
driven off the back foot to cover
misses out on a short delivery as he picks out Dilshan in the off side
starts full and it's eased down the ground to long on
paddle-sweeps this from around off stump over his shoulder and down towards fine leg
down the pitch and whips along the ground through midwicket
played into the off side
comes down the track and drives just to the right of mid-off who is inside the circle
excellent power and placement, goes over the top as he launches a full delivery over the long-off rope
back-to-back sixes, for different batsmen, as Root brings out the slog sweep as he picks the googly from Jeevan and clears wide long on
driven down to long on
more aggression from Taylor as he comes down the pitch and lofts it over mid-on who had been brought inside the circle, clears him comfortable and beats long off who was running around
full delivery, eased down the ground to long off
opens the face and finds short third man, they get a bonus run as the bowler misses the throw with both Taylor and Root alert to the situation
full on leg stump, defended
outside off, pushed into the off side and that takes him to a maiden ODI fifty
angled into the pads, Root misses his flick
angled to short third man, another single straight to a fielder for this pair
down the pitch, loses his shape a little and ends up heaving it through midwicket
driven up to mid-off who fumbles but it wouldn't have been able to stop the run
paddles this from outside off behind square on the leg side...Sangakkara saw Taylor shaping for the shot and started to move to his left, but the ball was well wide of him
back of a length, pulls it through straight midwicket
now he uses his feet to the quick, too, and whips it through midwicket although wasn't entirely in control as his bottom hand came off the bat

jabs down on a full delivery, there's an appeal for caught behind...the umpires come together for a chat, and decide to go upstairs. This is not a player review. Pictures aren't especially clear. The ball goes under the toe-end of Taylor's bat. And it's given not out.
angled into the pads, flicked to deep midwicket
another appeal, for lbw this time, as Root falls across his shot but the keeper was heading down the leg side...easily missing the stumps
that was a tight run! Dabbed square of the wicket and Taylor would have been struggling with a direct hit from backward point
full on the stumps, worked to deep midwicket
dragged down short, pulled in front of square but straight to the man in the deep
pushed down the leg side, would have been a wide if Root hadn't caught up with it and flicked to deep backward square
worked from outside off into the leg side
short and wide outside off, Taylor crashes this through the covers but just a single to the sweeper
driven square to point
good delivery, full and straight, Taylor wanting to use his feet again and digs it out to the leg side...gets a few words from Prasad
full toss, he can't beat mid-on which will annoy him
full again, outside off and some late swing into Taylor who jabs it out towards the keeper
moment of fortune for Taylor who was coming down the pitch again gets an inside edge just past leg stump and down to fine leg
full outside off, whipped with bottom hand to mid-on and another sharp single
nice drive from Root to a full delivery but it's a good piece of fielding at mid-off by the captain
off stump and quite full, pressed towards point
stays leg side to drive a straighter ball to extra cover

stays leg side of this again, goes to drive again and gets bowled! The change works for Sri Lanka, Herath has struck with perhaps a quicker ball that Root has misjudged. He should have been playing much straighter but tried to slash it square and missed, losing his middle and off stumps, partnership broken
floaty full delivery, Bopara forward and pressing into the covers
straighter ball, defended up the wicket
opens the face to steer this wide of extra cover, it was in the air for a time
full length on off stump, Bopara forward playing firmly into the covers
fuller ball, driven to extra cover where there's a misfield and they get a run
blockhole ball, Taylor gets it off the toe to extra cover
another very full ball, dug out towards mid-on, they take on the fielder and a direct hit would have seen Taylor gone
touch wider line, driven on the bounce to backward point who can't take it cleanly and they get a single
cutter, a touch short, pulled out to deep square, Taylor gets an official warning here for running on the pitch, a few times he's gone up the middle
forward on off stump, playing with the outer half of the bat to cover
with the inner half this time, gets a thick-edged single into midwicket
fuller length, punched down to long-off
touch short, cut out to deep cover
full length rolled back to the bowler
down the track and slapped down to long-off
length ball on the stumps, patted back to the bowler
down the wicket, the bowler adjusts his length a little and Bopara can only push this to mid-off
similar length, this time Bopara stays in the crease and tucks this down to long leg
touch short and Taylor with very fast hands pulls and gets four through deep square
line a foot outside off this time and Taylor cuts to cover
fuller length, played forward and nudged to midwicket
short and Taylor cuts strangely up the wicket without timing so the bowler can field
cut again to a ball not that short and finds cover
back to pull this time finding midwicket now
finally finds the gap, nudging this up between mid-off and extra cover for a single
full length, played back to the bowler
paddle swept off the stumps fine of deep backward square, Bopara runs hard and gets back for two
down the track, meets this on the full from outside off and clips it down to long-on
cut hard, comes off a but of a top edge but well short of short third man
back and clips this through square leg for an easy single
down the track, taps this up on the leg side, short midwicket can't cut it off
tad short, Bopara back pressing firmly down to long-on
down the track, aims off side and gets it away nicely, played a little in-to-out to send it over mid-off, comfy gap back there, one bounce four
full ball pressed to short midwicket
touch more off stump line and pressed down to long-on
started to advance, the bowler fired it at leg stump, Taylor swept and missed, there was a ricochet into the off side and they scamper a single
leg stump line, flicked through square leg, 150 up
right back in the crease, pulled hard but only to short midwicket where the cool cookie Mathews makes the save
goes to sweep and gets struck on the pad, it deflects into the covers
back foot and clipped with the spin to square leg
tucks this in front of square leg this time so they scamper a single
great shot, took a shimmy down, the bowler dropped his length, Taylor adjusts and gets right down to sweep and nails it in the gap between the two deep fielders
down again, single whipped out to deep midwicket
tries to create some length with a backward step but is hurried into forcing this to midwicket
quicker ball touched to short long leg

full length ran to mid-on, they take a quick single and then...hoho! The fielder throws it right over the keeper's head and it races away for four overthrows! Deep square charged around trying to save the boundary but to no avail, what an awful throw, think it was Thisara Perera
leg stump line and swept out to deep square
full length whipped out to long-on, always so calm is Bopara
but this is leg side runs, two of them wide of long-on, excellent placement and running
cramped a little around middle and leg, forces this to short midwicket
back tickling this around the corner, an easy single
driven down the ground, not the best timing so they could get a second but long-on is around in time
back just defending this up the wicket
dropped from the off stump in front of point for a sharp single

down the wicket, aiming over the off side, gets it off the toe and squirts it to cover! A shame for Taylor who's missed out on a century on his return to the side but he's played very nicely indeed. Aiming over the off side here, trying to play in-to-out, didn't get it quite right, it looped to where cover was shuffling back and claimed an easy catch
way down the leg side
tapped off the stumps into the leg side, no single available
back covering up in front of off stump
back flicking this through square leg for an easy single
does so here with a nudge into the leg side, an easy single to get Morgan going

back looking to force down the ground and it's through him! Onto Bopara faster than he was anticipating and he's lost his middle and off stumps. Like Root, a total misjudgment really, he exposed his stumps and the delivery ran on and through his stroke, might have kept a touch low
shoveled down the leg side
back clipped out through the leg side
also back forcing this from middle stump to cover
gets forward now and defends up the wicket
full ball outside off, Buttler misjudges the length a little and plays and misses outside off
goes to cut and just finds cover
back nudging this up to short midwicket
fuller ball, driven with snappy wrists wide of deep cover so they can get a second
back and tucked from the off stump to deep cover
leg stump line and swept hard and backward of square, poor line from the bowler
full length outside off, clipped down to long-on
back punching to the bowler
down the track but just reaching out to block back to the bowler
back now playing up the wicket
goes to cut this hard and gets a thick underedge that goes past leg stump and inside short long leg for an easy single
back pressing this to the bowler
long stride forward, this is pressed wide enough of extra-cover to allow a sharp single
played from the crease off a straight line to midwicket
more leg stump line, tickled to short long leg
floated up outside off and Buttler has room to swing the arms and swings handsomely way back over long-off, so well timed, didn't seem to hit it that hard
straighter line and this is blocked up the wicket
this grips a little and Buttler just defends in front of all three
length ball pressed out to deep cover
nudged off a straight line out to deep square
forward and pressed steadily down the ground for an easy run
back and clipped out to deep midwicket
forward pressing from off stump to extra-cover
tossed up a bit more, ran out down to long-off
reverse swept very firmly and I think this has cannoned straight off the shins of short long leg, ouchie
forward press back to the bowler
touch fuller, clipped to mid-off this time
touch straighter line and worked wide of short long leg for a quick single
solid forward defence
another forward press, into the leg side this time
more air outside off, pressed firmly out to deep cover
flatter ball, tucked firmly into short midwicket going back
forward now getting a thick inside edge to square leg
back foot press out to deep cover and the batsman collide mid-pitch which means any thoughts of a second are forgotten
forward pressing down the ground, short extra charges across and slides to save the run
nudged from the crease through the covers to bring the 200 up
down the wicket clipping this out to long-on
down the track, meets this on the full and clips out to long-on
full length, clipped from off stump to long-on

down the wicket, goes in the air down the ground and picks out long-on. No where near enough club on that, bit of an inside edge and it was a straightforward chance to Jaywardene running a few yards to his left. A big wicket for Sri Lanka who have kept things very quiet since the batting Powerplay
this is off the square though, flicked out through square leg from a full length
full length again and flicked down the ground for an easy single
swept off the stumps, big top edge and it flies over short long leg running back, it was Herath trying to get there and he was never in the frame to take that
back and punched down to long-on
full length, pushed firmly off an inside edge to deep square, they rightly refuse the second
swept from outside off to deep square, keeps it down this time
swept and misses, it's drifting well down for the half-hearted lbw cry
floated up, pressed from just outside off to cover
poor line down leg but Morgan misses out and only mistimes a sweep to short long leg

leg side line again and this time Morgan misses with a sweep, no wide given not sure why, a little pad perhaps? Sangakkara whips off the bails and they check upstairs but Morgan's back foot never shifted
low full toss slapped down the ground, beats mid-off and a most-welcome boundary for England
down leg side again, Morgan sweeps and gets something on it, it runs very fine and they get a single, another one Morgan has rather missed out on
back to a touch short delivery and pulled very hard wide of deep midwicket

swept up into the leg side but gets it too high and not long enough, the catch taken by deep square running to his right. A firm strike off a middle and leg line but the timing not quite there, it was a big top edge really, and another wicket falls
forward press down the ground, in the air for a time but safely down the ground
forward nudging from just outside off to backward point
Morgan not deterred by the wickets going down, slog sweep over midwicket, lovely strike
Dilshan tosses this up again but Morgan resists and presses down to long-off
down the track but only nudging this to short midwicket
this drifts down the leg side
down the track, bit of a thick inside edge down to long-on
forward press on the off stump only back to the bowler
back to cut, gets it past point and wide of deep cover for a couple
reached for outside off and slapped down to long-on
length ball tucked from leg stump wide of square leg for a sharp single
full length clipped down to long-on
driven from just outside off, thick outside edge runs fine and they can scramble three
whipped off the leg stump but straight to deep midwicket
forward trying to squirt this past extra cover but can't, fielder does well

a very slow loopy delivery that Woakes tries to slap into the leg side and he's bowled, missing it by a mile really. Couldn't pick up the pace of the delivery, swung right across it and got cleaned up, Woakes has really struggled with spin this tour
forward getting a little nudge on this into square leg
very delicate paddle sweep from a full length on the stumps, gets it fine of short long leg for two
similar line and this time conventionally swept and gets it backward of square for four

waited for and cut hard straight to backward point! Rocking back to try and force this away through the off side, Jordan is early on the stroke and chipped it straight to the fielder who gleefully claimed an easy catch
length on off stump, blocked up the wicket
flicked back up the wicket, the bowler goes to his right and fields well
Finn now gets the single, going back to force firmly down to long-on
back dabbing through point, Morgan trying to ensure he's on strike for the final over
straight delivery, firm forward defence
slog swept over deep midwicket, a good thump taken from just outside off and Morgan finally has a fifty
down the track and whacks this even further, over long-on this time
dragged from outside off only to mid-on, nearly took out Finn who did very well to avoid that
wide outside off and this is hoiked over extra-cover, another good strike and a one-bounce four
quicker ball, swung leg side, gets a thick inside edge but behind deep square and they get back for the second

slog swept again but Morgan hasn't got this at all, it's gone straight up and Sangakkara runs out to take the catch. Good work from the keeper to run up the wicket to take that because it went a long way up

inn2.comm: full and angling in towards leg stump, takes the pad into the leg side
back of a length on off stump, defended into the leg side
lovely from Dilshan, comes forward and strokes a full delivery on off stump straight of mid-on...no brute force in that, just timing
poor delivery, low full toss on leg stump, but he gets away with it as Dilshan flicks straight to long
full outside off, left alone
good delivery, full around off stump, defended with a straight bat
full and straight, worked out to midwicket
on a good length, just outside off, defended into the covers
too full this time, and too wide, Dilshan flays a drive through the off side
adjusts by going straighter, nips into Dilshan, tucked off the pads to deep square
that's what he loves, width outside off, and Kusal cashes in as he slices in the air over backward point
full toss on leg stump, aiming for the yorker, it's given a run as he deflects down to long leg but England were half interested in the lbw...looked to be outside the line of leg stump as well
short of a length on the pads, lobs into the leg side and they scamper a leg bye
full on off stump, defended into the covers
that's a good line, tight on off stump, defended back to the bowler
keeping it full at off stump, Dilshan plays watchfully from the crease
gets a fraction straighter and fuller, Dilshan flicks it sweetly but picks out Hales at short midwicket
full on off stump, gets stride forward and blocks
full on middle, defended back to Woakes in his followthrough
short delivery, angled across outside off, Kusal tries to pull but can't catch up with the delivery and is comfortably beaten
very full outside off, he brings his bat down with an angled face which sends the ball wide of the slips to third man
sweet, from Dilshan, so sweet...leans into another on-drive as Woakes gets a fraction full and straight. Beats Moeen's dive at mid-on
that could have been a boundary, too, as it was a juicy delivery on the pads but Dilshan's clip finds Bell at square leg although a fumble does allow a single
slower ball, comes out as a friendly full toss but Kusal can only bunt it to mid-off
clipped off the stumps to square leg
gets back outside off, it's a cutter from Finn, and defeats Dilshan's attempt to cut
pushed down the leg side, he'll have to bowl that again
back on off stump, defended into the leg side
full and driven without much timing to mid-off
works a straight delivery behind square on the leg side
he gets dispatched. Dismissive from Kusal as he drives a full delivery on the up over mid-off

massive blow! They've snaffled Dilshan. It was a short-of-a-length delivery which Dilshan tried to carve it away over the covers but only succeeded in getting a top edge which looped into the off side, where Morgan back-tracked well from inside the circle
full on middle and off, defended into the covers
lovely shot, nothing cultured about that, all elegance as he leans into a textbook cover drive although it's a superbly committed chase from Ian Bell and he manges to flick it back
on off stump, gets across the crease and defends
doesn't get much better, a punchy on-drive from outside off whistles straight of mid-on...we've seen thousands of them from Sangakkara, but they never get dull
full and straight, he on-drives again but finds mid-on
nice start, hint of drift into the left hander, comes forward and defends
round the wicket, fuller, driven down to long on
full on off stump, stroked gently down to long off
goes deep into the crease and back-cuts to backward point
short and wide, spins away wider, cut through the off side and chased down hard by Root
defended out to cover
back of a length outside off, played to backward point
puts it on a length to drive, which Sangakkara does to short cover
slower delivery, defended into midwicket
poor delivery, short and wide, Sangakkara has all the time in the world to pick his spot and then places the ball through point
tightens his line, back full at off stump, defended into the off side
full, angling into Sangakkara, defended into the off side
full on off stump, head over the ball and defends
loops it full, played into the covers
loses his length and line a toucher, wider outside off, but Kusal's cut goes straight to cover
watchfully defended to short cover
after four dots balls he decides to try and release the pressure, lofts in the air over the off side although the bat twisted in his hand
driven down to long off
short of a length outside off, rolls his wrists and guides it down to third man
full, pushed across outside off, carefully defended into the off side
good save by Buttler, that was nearly four leg byes, as Finn strays on the pads and it deflects fine but Buttler springs to his right and it only costs a single
on a length at off stump, opens the face and finds backward point
full outside off, Kusal puts everything behind a drive but it squirts off the outer half of the bat to backward point
dropped in short and it costs him as Kusal pulls with ease in front of square which gives deep square no chance
nicely bowled, some grip and it turns past the outside edge with Sangakkara forcing to the off side
tighter line and a more defence prod this time
leg stump line, swept and a save by short long leg, still a single on a misfield
firm press through point and runs it out into the deep
just a touch wide, reached for a lifted over extra-cover, decent timing and well over the infield
touch fuller and ran to extra-cover this time
full length on off stump, touched in front of point and they take a sharp single before Stokes can get in
almost the same situation, a quick run in front of point
a big leg side heave to a delivery not all that short, finds short midwicket
straighter line, worked down to long leg
forward to a full ball just outside off, another quick run into the covers
stays leg side of this and carves it down to third man
stays around the wicket, straight line, smothered coming well forward
a touch more air but again just covering up is Perera
just a tad short and Perera is right back cutting out to deep cover
slip is in, this is floated up outside off, Sangakkara presses it firmly out through the covers to the sweeper
big stride in, blocking this just outside off stump
straighter line, tucked just backward of square leg for an easy single
around the wicket, wide of off stump, Perera tries to slash it square on the off side and gets a thick underedge on the bounce to the keeper
straighter line, angled out through square leg
another ball angled in, tucked out square on the on side
almost the same delivery, this is tickled down to long leg
touch more off stump now, Sangakkara coming forward just in defence
forward press to a ball just a touch wider of off stump, finds point

floated up just outside off, driven and edged to slip! Perera can change his gloves again now, driving a touch loosely at a ball just wide enough to entice the drive, it's turned just enough to take a thick outside edge and Jordan has held a sharp chance at slip, well bowled Moeen
leg slip in place, straight line, fiicked into the leg side, diving save at short midwicket
forward press to a more off stump line and blocked back to the bowler
gets across his stumps and sweeps with the spin behind square, nice stroke
flatter ball, flicked in the air for a time but short and wide of a diving short midwicket
this turns down the leg side and evades Buttler and leg slip and skips away to the fence
back of a length just outside off, dabbed down to third man
wide full delivery, driven hard, backward point - Stokes - makes a diving save that probably saves four
full at the stumps, jammed out to short midwicket
forward just outside off, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length and wide of off stump, cut down to third man
full delivery at the off stump, Jayawardene solidly forward playing back to the bowler
down the track and flicked leg side, chase to the right for Bopara from deep midwicket
stays back now and drops this in front of square leg for a quick single
forward flicking with the turn, it just evades Morgan at short midwicket
a foot and a half outside off, Sangakkara lets this go through
fuller ball, punched down to long-off
flicked with the turn from just outside off but this time Morgan is able to field
full delivery just outside off, pressed back to the bowler
forward press again, this time gets it down to long-on
slog sweep fetched leg side and lands just in front of Woakes at deep midwicket, not that far from the fielder
forward on the stumps to play back to the bowler
wider line, pressed back to the bowler again
fuller length and knocked down to long-off
around the wicket, just back of a length, punched to extra cover
slips down leg and Sangakkara gets a tickle on it
full ball back on the stumps, this is driven steadily to mid-on
touch wide, driven out to deep cover
length ball just outside off, chopped down to third man
cutter I think, wide of off stump but Sangakkara can only find backward point
back tapping a length ball in front of point for a quick single
driven from the crease straight to cover on the edge of the circle
more air, just smothered up on the off side
down the track a little and driven out to long-off
length ball, worked out through square leg
pressed forward and in the air for a long time towards short extra, lands just short of a diving Morgan
clipped off the pads to deep square
full outside off from round the wicket, driven into the covers
wider outside off, Sangakkara lofts his cover drive and it goes one bounce to the sweeper
flicked from outside off to midwicket
driven up to mid-off
eased down the ground with a controlled flick of the wrists to long on...Sri Lanka's 100
plays with the spin and works it to backward square leg
good fielding, cuts off a boundary, as Jayawardene sweeps this but short fine leg dives across
too short, Sangakkara stays back and swivels on the pull to deep square
short again, pulled to deep square
nicely bowled, good line just outside off, draws Sangakkara forward and it takes a think outside edge to short third man
driven to short cover
gets beaten as he tries to glide this to third man
low full toss and expertly put away as Jayawardene sweeps it backward of square...poor delivery
full outside off, driven firmly to extra cover
opens the face and places it square through the off side
punched down the ground to long off
delicate touch as he dabs this down to third man
flicked from outside off into the leg side
that will please Surath as Sangakkara comes down the pitch, stays leg side of the ball, and effortlessly lofts it inside out over extra cover
full on off stump, defended into point
driven back to the bowler
this time he beats the bowler to his right hand...ticking over very easily at the moment
guided out to deep square
starts short, angled in at leg stump, he rolls his wrists and pulls to long leg
short again, sits up nicely and Sangakkara sees it early then pulls over midwicket
in the air, coming forward to drive, but he threads the gap through the off-side ring and the sweeper can't stop the second
full outside off, simply opens the faces and runs it down to third man
that's an awful delivery, some sort of attempted slower ball and it pitches miles down the leg side
back of a length on middle and off, dropped into the off side and these two barely need to say anything they have batted together so often
misfield at point by Bopara which gifts a single as Jayawardene drives a full delivery

not much more than half an appeal for lbw as Jayawardene plays across the line, but Morgan opts for the review. Well, this turned considerably and struck him in line with about middle, and Root has spun it too much so it will miss leg stump
flicked off the stumps into midwicket where Morgan flings himself to his right
finds the England captain again at midwicket but he's able to stay on his feet this time
shoved down the leg side
fired in fuller, Jayawardene sweeps strong but it goes straight to short fine leg
shorter delivery, dabbed square on the leg side
round the wicket, flicks a straight delivery to midwicket
stays leg side of the ball and angles down to third man
short ball, outside leg stump, loops over Sangakkara as he ducks and called wide. Frustration grows for Stokes
slower ball outside off, angled to third man
elegantly put away, he was offered width outside off and Jayawardene placed it backward of point to bisect deep cover and third man
another strong drive square of the wicket, stood tall this time and play it with a little more force
short and down the leg side, pulled to long leg...could easily have been another boundary
stunning batting, it's a friendly half volley outside but the way he drove that with precision to beat cover inside the circle and the sweeper was top class. The day gets worse for Stokes.
fired down the leg side, good take by Buttler
full outside off, driven to long off
worked from off stump through the leg side
pushed down the ground
just milking it at the moment, this one is pushed to long on
another slung down the leg side, Buttler again does well to prevent more than it just costing the wide
fantastic batting, and a great way to go to fifty as he gives himself a touch of room and lofts a skimming drive over cover
eased to long off to keep the strike
skids on as Sangakkara plays it off the back foot into the leg side
full outside off, flicked to midwicket
worked squarer this time through the leg side
slightly shorter, Sangakkara just hangs back, watches it turn a fraction and then works into midwicket
round the wicket, pushed across outside off, Jayawardene just caresses it through midwicket
picked off down the ground to end an over where five came without this pair breaking sweat
round the wicket, full outside off, driven firmly into the pitch and back to Jordan
slower ball, Sangakkara waits then works it from outside off through square leg and few two senior players they can still run a quick two when they want to
width outside off, a stand-and-deliver drive which whistles to deep cover
full at the stumps, worked into the leg side
places this backward of point with an open face
uses the angle from round the wicket and flicks out to deep square
waited for on the back foot and carved to backward point
another cut, this time through the infield, Stokes chasing round from deep cover slides and makes a decent save in the end
forward playing firmly to extra cover
down the wicket and flicked to short midwicket
a touch more air, this is floated up and then punched to deep cover
waits for this and turns backward of square on the leg side for an easy run
full delivery at the batsman who drives to midwicket off a thick inside edge

tries to play through the covers and drags this on! A desperately needed breakthrough for England. A lazy drive aiming through the off side and gets a thick inside edge into the ground and into the off stump. A seemingly gentle length ball a foot and a half wide of off stump has done for Jayawardene and maybe there's some hope for England
slip in but this is a waste, back of a length down leg
length just outside off, pushed at firmly and steers it down to third man
length just outside off, pressed straight to cover
slower ball, Sangakkara a touch early with the stroke and gets a thick inside edge up the wicket
full angled in at the stumps, pushed firmly to mid-on
touch short, worked around to square leg
forward from just outside off flicking to midwicket
reached for outside off and worked out down to long-on
full length flicked just past short midwicket and out into the deep for a single
straighter line, flicked around the corner to long leg
full length, driven down to long-off
length a long way outside off but Sangakkara can only tentatively prod it away square on the off side
good length, a prod outside off gets a thick edge down to third man
lovely flourishing cover drive to a ball a touch over-pitched but only finds deep cover
just back of a length at the stumps, clipped out to deep square
full ball flicked down to long leg
full at the stumps, also worked down to long leg
length just outside off, pressed off the back foot to extra cover
short, hooked at, gloved down the leg side, Buttler takes off and can't quite get there hurling himself to his left
fuller and straighter, worked off middle and off through square leg
back of a length and pulled in between deep square and long leg, between them they nearly balls the thing up and concede four but eventually Jordan from long leg cleans up
full ball pushed to extra-cover, a very sharp single and a dive is needed to ensure Sangakkara gets home
full at the off stump, Mathews nearly plays around it but pushes to leg
back of a length, nudged out through square leg, they try to run hard and get back for a second but refuse
back of a length just outside off but Mathews shuffles across and gets a run through square leg
pressed forward just outside, opens the face slightly to get it wide of short extra cover but not past the man in the ring
touch wider and steered down to third man
bumper, hooked at and missed, got quickly onto Mathews there, late on the shot and very close to the glove again
length ball just outside off, pressed into the covers from the crease
forward to drive and mistimes it into midwicket
waited for and delicately angled down to third man
playing forward gets a thin outside edge that runs fine of third man, Jordan sloiding at the rope, has he dragged this back in time? Yes he did
bumper, well-directed, Mathews under it quickly
full at the stumps, flicked out through square leg
waited for and angled out wide of third man, chase round for Bopara who does well but they get back for a third
full delivery just outside off, driven firmly on the bounce to short extra-cover
back of a length, Sangakkara waits for this and then delightfully angles the bat to lift it almost directly over Buttler, a late uppercut if you will, a slight top edge but very safe
touch fuller and straighter and pulled out to long leg
full ball angled into the stumps, this is touched through square leg for an easy single
good length at the off stump, played forward towards point and Mathews sends Sangakkara back
this time rolled straight to cover from the crease
full ball at the stumps, punched up the wicket, it bounces over Finn, then the stumps, then mid-off and finally mid-on cuts it off, timed far better than it seemed that
delicately dabbed into square leg for a comfortable single
full ball at the stumps, flicked out wide of deep square for a couple more
full ball at the off stump, driven without timing to cover
bumper, a little leg side ish but Mathews stepped right across his stumps to leave and that deterred Steve Davis from penalising the delivery
full at the off stump, dug out into midwicket
short ball, on target, easily ducked
not quite as short and pulled to deep square leg
length at the off stump, played easily back to the bowler
Mathews right back in his crease but can only fiddle it back up the wicket again
good from Woakes, tight to the off stump yet again, Mathews can only tap this up on the leg side, a hint of some pressure
then loosens the grip by slipping one down leg
middle and leg line, tucked out to deep square
full delivery at the off stump played carefully down to long-on
full again, easy runs nudged up in front of square again, this time on the off side
not quite to the pitch so has to flick across the line but steers it safely out through midwicket
full at the middle and off stumps, careful forward defence back to the bowler
down the track and slapped leg side, a miscue and it lands just short of mid-on and then skips away for runs into the deep, fortunate for Sangakkara who didn't get that at all
down again, lifting off side this time, just a chip and it lands safely in front of long-off

oh goodness me. Long hop outside off and Sangakkara has belted it straight to deep cover! What a miserable way to go. Terrible delivery but Sangakkara has thrown the kitchen sink at it, pretty much nailed it too, only to perfectly pick out the off side scout who doesn't have to move in pouching the catch, game on?
slip goes in, this is slid across the leftie who lets it go
tighter line, this is driven at and plays and misses
full at the off stump, pressed down the ground, they go for a single but the fielder, Woakes, can't gather, had he done so, that was a great run out chance, not the best call
full at the stumps, flicked to midwicket who saves well diving to his right, Root in there
length at the off stump, dabbed into midwicket for no run
full just outside off, dug out to short extra-cover
back of a length, a slash gets a thick top edge down to third man but this lands short of the fielder running in
fourth-stump line, Mathews content to just dab it towards midwicket, he needs to stay Dhoni-cool here
slides down leg, extras hurting England today again, that's the ninth wide
full at the stumps, clipped firmly out to deep square
just back of a length angled across Thirimanne who opens the face on it and guides down to third man
full right up there, touched into the leg side and they run hard and get back for the second before deep midwicket can come in
short and wide and cut only as far as backward point, Thirimanne misses out
waits for it to come across him and dabs down to third man
down the wicket and a swing and a miss, that's how Mathews got out in the last rubber
slower ball outside off, driven off the toe to extra cover
back of a length at the body, this is touched down to long leg
around the wicket, good move for me, cramps Thirimanne and he works it to cover only
length at the stumps, Mathews shuffles across to take a run down to long leg
short of a length and pulled hard through the fingertips of midwicket and away for four, precious boundary for Sri Lanka, would have been a miracle catch for Jordan
back of a length, waited for and delicately uppercut down towards third man, Moeen scrambles well to his right to save the boundary
back in the crease and touched wide of midwicket for a quick single, decent batting this
full and down leg, another wide, poor time for one
length at the stumps, tucked in front of long leg and they run hard and get back for the second
extra ball...goes for four! Double punishment for Finn, short ball helped on it's way fine of long leg
another wide, this well outside off, almost two whole extra overs England have sent down
now down leg, oh dear, went for a cutter and got it all wrong
finally a legal delivery, waited for and angled down to third man
length on off stump, played back up the wicket
gives him a little room - no need to take any risks at the moment - pushes only to cover
fuller length and driven firmly to extra cover
played forward and angled to backward point

full ball swung at hard, thick outside edge flies down to third man, in comes Hales...dropped! What a time to put a chance down, he was running in and reaching down but covered the ground in comfortable time and got his hands down but the ball popped through his fingers
back of a length and pulled firmly, sharp reaction stop from Jordan at short midwicket
back of a length on off stump, awkwardly played out into the covers
slower ball, gives himself a little room and cuts hard and gets it into the gap between point and cover, great shot, played one-handed in the end
back away again, Woakes follows him and cramps him up, this is just dabbed into midwicket
back of a length, paddled around and down to long leg
waits for this and tries to angle down to third man, plays and misses
length at the body, tucked down to long leg
around the wicket, back of a length outside off, goes to uppercut and misses
full angled in, a swing to leg, a miss, a cry for lbw, surely going down, it runs off backward of point for a leg bye
backs away to leg and drives a full ball past a diving extra cover, lovely stroke and just managed to pierce the packed off side field, just over and wide of James Taylor
tries to back away again but Jordan follows him and Mathews can only knock it back to the bowler
very full, driven off low on the bat to mid-off
length ball tried to be swung over the leg side, gets hit around the waist
down the wicket and drives hard through the off side, finds the gap wide of mid-off, nice stroke
full at the leg stump, clipped down to long leg
Mathews backs away again, Woakes follows him, Mathews then manages to get inside the line and flicks to long leg

down the wicket, tried to be swung over the off side, Thirimanne gets it high on the bat but ever-so-luckily manages to chip it just over the head of short extra-cover and short of the onrushing mid-off, rum luck for England
big leg side swing, it's wide enough of deep midwicket for them to charge back for two
around the wicket, swung into the leg side and it lands short of long-on steaming in, more fortune for the hosts, Thirimanne not in control of that stroke
very full at the leg stump, Mathews unable to pierce the off side ring
full ball, driven hard down the ground...only to mid-off. Absolutely no chance of a single. Thirimanne gets comfortably back into his ground
full ball squeezed away on the leg side, of this is well time and Jordan has to scramble across from long-on...and can't get there!
